Welcome to openjub-py’s documentation!¶

class openjub_py.Client(token, app_id=None, server='http://open.jacobs-cs.club/')[source]¶

A Client for the OpenJUB-API.

Parameters:
  • token – Token to use for authentication.
  • app_id – App Id to be used only when using authentication.
  • server – The Address of the OpenJUB server to use. Must include protocol, port and ending slash.
allFields = ['firstName', 'lastName', 'eid', 'type', 'email', 'username', 'major', 'country', 'description']¶

All possible fields that are availablw to the server.

user(q, limit=10, skip=0, fields=None)[source]¶

The /user endpoint.

Parameters:
  • q – Query to filter users
  • limit – Number of elements on one page
  • skip – Number of elements on one page
  • fields – List of Fields to return. Defaults to all fields.
Returns:

JSON-response to the request.
user_account(account, fields=None)[source]¶

The /user/:account endpoint.

Parameters:
  • account – Account to look for.
  • fields – List of Fields to return. Defaults to all fields.
Returns:

JSON-response to the request.
user_autocomplete(q, limit=10, skip=0, fields=None)[source]¶

The /user/autocomplete endpoint.

Parameters:
  • account – Account to look for.
  • fields – List of Fields to return. Defaults to all fields.
Returns:

JSON-response to the request.
user_eid(eid, fields=None)[source]¶

The /user/eid/:eid endpoint.

Parameters:
  • eid – eid to look for.
  • fields – List of Fields to return. Defaults to all fields.
Returns:

JSON-response to the request.
